TextView.android:text: COMFORT ZONE ACCORDING TO ISO7730 - The standard ISO773 is one approach for defining the comfort zone. However, this approach ignores the fact that higher temperatures can be tolerated at low humidity. Hence, its lower and upper temperature limits are vertical. This approach can be utilized in less complex applications for simpler execution of air-conditioning algorithms. Although temperature ranges are specified per season, the relative humidity is set between 70%RH and 30%RH (Figure 1) in summer and winter time, respectively. The limits are set to reduce the risk of eye irritation, dry or wet skin, microbial growth, and respiratory diseases.
